Exaggerate: The claim may be considered exaggerated as it states that every new Republican member of the U.S. Senate said they "will vote to repeal and replace Obamacare," without providing evidence for every single member.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or quotes from every new Republican member of the U.S. Senate to back up the statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all new Republican members of the U.S. Senate are in agreement on repealing and replacing Obamacare, without considering the possibility of differing opinions within the Republican party.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for the statements made by the Republican candidates, such as political rhetoric during election campaigns, which may not necessarily translate into immediate action once in office.
